title: Mother of Elon Musk’s child sues xAI, alleges Grok generated explicit deepfakes of her
snippet: Ashley St Clair, Elon Musk's child's mother, has sued xAI for generating explicit deepfake images of her via Grok AI. She claims emotional distress and loss of privacy, while xAI counters that she breached contract by filing in the wrong court. Several countries are considering banning Grok.

title: What is Merge Labs? OpenAI invests in Sam Altman-backed BCI startup taking on Neuralink
snippet: OpenAI is investing in Sam Altman's BCI startup Merge Labs, which aims to enhance human capabilities through innovative brain-computer interfaces.&nbsp;

title: OpenAI is taking on Google Translate with new ChatGPT powered translator: how to use, features and more
snippet: OpenAI has introduced ChatGPT Translate, a new AI tool aimed at competing with Google Translate.The new tool offers translation for over 50 languages, understands tone and context, and allows users to customize translations.&nbsp;

title: Verizon issues $20 credits to customers after massive outage: How to claim, when will you get it? — all FAQs answered
snippet: Verizon credit for outage: $20 credits issued to customers affected by massive outage caused by a ‘software issue’. The company acknowledged not meeting customer expectations and stated the credits would compensate for multiple days of service.

title: Nothing confirms its first India flagship store in Bengaluru: All you need to know
snippet: Nothing has confirmed plans to open its first flagship store in India in Bengaluru. The upcoming outlet will offer hands-on access to its smartphones, earbuds and other devices, marking the brand’s second flagship store worldwide.

title: iPhone 17e tipped to gain Dynamic Island but miss out on 120Hz display
snippet: Apple’s upcoming iPhone 17e is tipped to adopt the Dynamic Island design while retaining a 60Hz OLED display. Leaks also point to an A19 chip, possible MagSafe support and a familiar camera setup, with pricing expected to remain unchanged.

title: Prime Members countdown: Best 5G tablets for productivity and entertainment from top brands
snippet: The Prime Members countdown highlights the top 5G tablets for work and entertainment, combining speed, performance, and connectivity, with exciting deals arriving during the Amazon Republic Day Sale.

title: Amazon Great Republic Day Sale 2026 is just hours away with top gadget deals lined up
snippet: As the Amazon Sale 2026 nears, early highlights include strong deals on earphones, headphones, tablets and smartwatches, making it an ideal time to plan gadget upgrades.

title: Sony PlayStation Plus January 2026 adds Resident Evil Village and Like a Dragon: Infinite Wealth
snippet: Sony has revealed the PS Plus Game Catalogue lineup for January 2026, confirming earlier leaks. Resident Evil Village and Like a Dragon: Infinite Wealth headline a strong mix of horror, RPG, racing and indie titles arriving on January 20 for Extra and Premium members.

title: Flipkart Republic Day Sale 2026: iPhone 16, Pixel 10 and Vivo devices get major price cuts
snippet: Flipkart Republic Day Sale 2026 begins on January 17, bringing discounts on smartphones, laptops and electronics. Deals include iPhone 16, Pixel 10 and Vivo T4 series, along with early access for Plus and Black members and HDFC bank offers.

title: Taiwan aims to be strategic AI partner with US under tariff deal
snippet: The Trump administration ‌has pushed ‌Taiwan, a major semiconductor producer, to invest more in the U.S., specifically ‌in making the chips that are powering the trend towards AI.

title: Study-abroad loans slump; Tiger Global’s tax blow
snippet: Happy Friday! Study-abroad loans have fallen sharply in 2025, with the US corridor feeling the brunt of the decline. This and more in today’s ETtech Morning Dispatch.

title: AI startups must turn their pilots into scalable products: Google India VP Preeti Lobana
snippet: Google India’s Preeti Lobana urged AI startups to turn pilot projects into scalable, revenue-generating products. title: Labour code rollout looms large over margins of IT firms
snippet: Indian IT firms like TCS, Infosys, and HCLTech are seeing profit margins shrink due to new labour rules and one-time accounting provisions. Wage bills could rise 3–5% regularly, affecting future salary hikes and take-home pay. Companies await clarity from the government before adjusting pay structur

title: Indian IT shaking off demand blues as client spends tick up
snippet: India’s $283 billion IT services industry is showing signs of recovery in 2026, boosted by rising discretionary client spending and AI-driven deals. Infosys and HCLTech have raised revenue guidance following strong contract wins, while TCS reports healthy demand despite macro uncertainties. Analysts

title: VC firm Kairon Capital debuts with Rs 200 crore fund
snippet: Deepankur Malhotra, a former executive at Amazon India, where he focused on investing in consumer brands, has launched a consumer-focused venture capital firm, Kairon Capital, with a target corpus of Rs 200 crore, including a Rs 50-crore greenshoe option.

title: VC firm Kairon Capital debuts with Rs 200 crore fund
snippet: Deepankur Malhotra, a former executive at Amazon India, where he focused on investing in consumer brands, has launched a consumer-focused venture capital firm, Kairon Capital, with a target corpus of Rs 200 crore, including a Rs 50-crore greenshoe option.

title: Student loan companies feel the pressure of US visa squeeze
snippet: Education loans for studying abroad fell 30–50% in 2025, hit hardest by tighter US visa norms. Students are turning to Europe and smaller destinations, but loans are smaller and repayment risks higher. Lenders, especially NBFCs, are shifting focus to domestic programmes and alternative geographies t

snippet: Hyderabad-born Chintala, who joined Thinking Machines Lab in November 2025, will replace Barret Zoph who stepped down as CTO.
